intro: Palmeria coriacea, commonly known as the rough palmeria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and hairy, thick leaves that are adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Palmeria coriacea is often found in rocky habitats and is valued for its resilience in harsh environments.
